[12 & 13 Geo. 5.]A.D. 1922.SCHEDULES.FIRST SCHEDULE.General Rules por the Loading op Ships with Petroleum.1. Before any petroleum is so loaded due notice shall be 5 given to the harbourmaster of the time and place of such loading.2. No petroleum shall be loaded at any place within a harbour other than such place as the harbourmaster shall from time to time direct.3. Petroleum shall not be loaded except between the hours of sunrise and sunset: Provided that tank steamers which shall have commenced loading not less than one hour before sunset shall be permitted to continue such loading.4. Between the time when the loading of petroleum on a 15 ship has first commenced and the time when such loading is completed and the holds or tanks are securely closed down, there shall be no fire or artificial light on board such ship or at or near the place where the petroleum is being loaded : Provided that this rule, shall not prevent the use of a safety lamp of a 20 construction approved by the harbourmaster.5. Adequate steps shall be taken to prevent any person from smoking at or near the place where petroleum -is being loaded, and to prevent any person engaged in such loading from carrying fuses, matches or any appliance whatsoever for pro- 25 during ignition.6. No petroleum contained in casks, barrels or other vessels shall be loaded in a harbour unless such vessels are staunch and free from leakage, and are of such strength and construction as not to be liable to be broken or to leak except in case of gross 30 carelessness or extraordinary accident.7. No petroleum shall be brought to the place of loading until the ship into which it is to be loaded is in readiness to receive the same.8. No petroleum shall be discharged or allowed to escape 35 into the waters of a harbour.9. All due precautions shall be taken for the prevention of accidents by fire in loading petroleum.10. Every ship during the loading of petroleum shall be watched by a competent person on board such ship. 40 [12 & 13 Geo. 5.] Petroleum.SECOND SCHEDULE.
